intro: Arctium kokanicum, commonly known as the Kokanica burweed, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and thistles, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces spiny, bristly fruits that contain seeds, a feature common among members of its family. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a rough, hairy texture. Arctium kokanicum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
